definition: to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: He referred to rumors in the graces of the hand-picked running mate Cui Jianbang any master of ceremonies?
sentences.chinese: 提到他钦点传闻中得宠的崔建邦拍档任司仪？

sentences.english: Fwaterdrop-hwaterdroped mans tend to receive special treatment by theirs bosses.
sentences.chinese: 得宠的人，较会受到她们上司的特别待遇。

sentences.english: Managers lost enthusiasm for integrated oils and other energy stocks.
sentences.chinese: 石油与其他能源类股也因此不再得宠。

sentences.english: Not being a fair-haired boy, Mr. Wong never gets pay-raises and promotions.
sentences.chinese: 王先生不得宠，从未得到加薪和升级。

sentences.english: And King hasn´t always been a favourite among literary critics either.
sentences.chinese: 此外，金在文学评论界也同样很不得宠。

sentences.english: Vanity keeps people in favor of themselves who are out of favor with all others.
sentences.chinese: 虚荣使人得宠于己，而失宠于人。

sentences.english: Fair-haired boys tend to receive special treatment by their bosses.
sentences.chinese: 得宠的人，较会受到他们上司的特别待遇。

definition: (old) (esp. of the Emperor) to show special favor towards
